mdRecord.dcterms:title: Pocket surgical instrument set
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:medium: metal; ivory (tooth component); wood (plant material); tortoise shell [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The following instruments are contained in a leather and fabric case: scalpel - wood and metal, V.W Brinckerhoff New York; finger knife, Willms; probe - sterling; 3 lancets - abscess, shell and metal; tenaculum - ivory and metal; 2 scalpels - shell and metal; scalpel - ivory and metal, Browne; spatula and elevator - metal; operating scissors - metal; grooved director - metal; male catheter - metal; female catheter - metal; urethral applicator - metal; 3 lancet blades - metal; 2 surgical stitching (suture) needles - metal, 5 cm and 3.5cm; thread - fabric.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments and apparatus
